label: data field
definition: A data item which is a location for a predetermined type of data.
example of usage: The "specimen collector sample ID" is where one can store sample identifiers given by the specimen collector.
editor note: Value specification axioms will be applied to fields when true in all instances of a field. They have not yet been applied since they are undergoing a community review as of December 2022.

label: identifier field
definition: A data field which describes a symbol that is part of a centrally registered identifier database (CRID) and that is sufficient to look up a record from the CRID's registry.
example of usage: third party lab sample ID field

label: specimen collector sample ID field
alternative label: specimen collector sample ID|sample_collector_sample_ID|sample collector sample identifier
definition: An identifier data field which describes the user-defined name for the sample.
comment: Example Guidance: Every Sample ID from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible.
english exact synonym: specimen collector sample ID slot|sample collector sample identifier field|sample collector sample identifier slot

label: third party lab service provider name field
alternative label: third party lab service provider name
definition: A data field which describes the name of the third party company or laboratory that provided services.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the full, unabbreviated name of the company or laboratory.
english exact synonym: third party lab service provider name slot

label: third party lab sample ID field
alternative label: third party lab sample ID|third party lab sample identifier
definition: A data field which describes the identifier assigned to a sample by a third party service provider.
comment: Example Guidance: Store the sample identifier supplied by the third party services provider.
english exact synonym: third party lab sample ID slot|third party lab sample identifier field|third party lab sample identifier slot

label: epidemiology case ID field
definition: A data field which describes the identifier used to specify an epidemiologically detected case of disease.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the case identifer. The case ID greatly facilitates linkage between laboratory and epidemiological data. The case ID may be considered identifiable information. Consult the data steward before sharing.
english exact synonym: case ID slot|case identifier field|case identifier slot

label: related specimen primary ID field
alternative label: related specimen primary ID|related specimen primary identifier
definition: A data field which describes the primary identifer of a related specimen previously submitted to the repository.
comment: Example Guidance: Store the primary ID of the related specimen previously submitted to the National Microbiology Laboratory so that the samples can be linked and tracked through the system.
english exact synonym: related specimen primary ID slot|related specimen primary identifier field|related specimen primary identifier slot

label: IRIDA sample name field
definition: A data field which describes the identifer assigned to a sequenced isolate in Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis (IRIDA) bioinformatics platform.
comment: Example Guidance: Store the IRIDA sample name. The IRIDA sample name will be created by the individual entering data into the IRIDA platform. IRIDA samples may be linked to metadata and sequence data, or just metadata alone. It is recommended that the IRIDA sample name be the same as, or contain, the specimen collector sample ID for better traceability. It is also recommended that the IRIDA sample name mirror the GISAID accession. IRIDA sample names cannot contain slashes. Slashes should be replaced by underscores. See IRIDA documentation for more information regarding special characters (https://irida.corefacility.ca/documentation/user/user/samples/#adding-a-new-sample).
english exact synonym: IRIDA sample name slot|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample name field|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample name slot|IRIDA sample identifier slot|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample identifier field|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample identifier slot| IRIDA sample ID slot|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample ID field|Integrated Rapid Infectious Disease Analysis sample ID slot

label: umbrella bioproject accession field
definition: An identifier data field which describes the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) umbrella accession number of the BioProject to which the BioSample belongs.
comment: Example Guidance: Required if submission is linked to an umbrella BioProject. An umbrella BioProject links together related BioProjects. A valid BioProject umbrella accession has prefix PRJN, PRJE or PRJD. Your laboratory can have one or many BioProjects.

label: bioproject accession field
definition: An identifier data field which describes the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
comment: Example Guidance: Required if submission is linked to a BioProject. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. A valid BioProject accession has prefix PRJN, PRJE or PRJD, e.g., PRJNA12345 and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project. Your laboratory can have one or many BioProjects.

label: biosample accession field
definition: A data field which describes the identifier assigned to a BioSample in International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) archives.
comment: Example Guidance: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN, while ENA BioSamples will have the prefix SAMEA.

label: SRA accession field
definition: A data field which describes the Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC).
comment: DDBJ = DNA DataBank of Japan  Example Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted .run.. NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR, EBI-ENA runs start with ERR and DRA accessions start with DRR.
english exact synonym: SRA accession slot|Sequence Read Archive accession field|Sequence Read Archive accession slot

label: GenBank accession field
definition: A data field which describes the GenBank/ENA/DDBJ identifier assigned to the sequence in the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) archives.
comment: GenBank = National Genetic Sequence Data Base; ENA = European Nucleotide Archive; DDBJ = DNA DataBank of Japan  Example Guidance: Store the accession returned from a GenBank/ENA/DDBJ submission (viral genome assembly).
english exact synonym: GenBank accession slot|GenBank/ENA/DDBJ accession slot|GenBank/ENA/DDBJ accession field|National Genetic Sequence Data Base accession field|National Genetic Sequence Data Base accession slot

label: GISAID accession field
definition: An identifier data field which describes the Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data (GISAID) accession number assigned to the sequence.
comment: Example Guidance: Store the accession returned from the GISAID submission.
english exact synonym: GISAID accession slot|Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data accession field|Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data accession slot

label: GISAID virus name field
definition: An identifier data field which describes the user-defined Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data (GISAID) virus name assigned to the sequence.
comment: Example Guidance: GISAID virus names should be in the format .hCoV-19/Country/Identifier/year..
english exact synonym: GISAID virus name slot|Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data virus name field|Global Initiative on Sharing Avian Influenza Data virus name slot

label: host specimen voucher field
definition: A data field which describes the identifier for the physical specimen.
example of usage: URI example: http://portal.vertnet.org/o/fmnh/mammals?id=33e55cfe-330b-40d9-aaae-8d042cba7542, INSDC triplet example: UAM:Mamm:52179
comment: Example Guidance: Include a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) in the form of a URL providing a direct link to the physical host specimen. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical host voucher specimen. If a URI is not available, a museum-provided globally unique identifier (GUID) can be used. If no persistent unique identifier is available, follow the INSDC guidance for populating the voucher_specimen attribute using standard triplets for institution codes (i.e., /specimen_voucher=.[<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]]<specimen_id>.): http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-specimenvoucher-qualifier
english exact synonym: host specimen voucher slot|host specimen voucher identifier field|host specimen voucher identifier slothost specimen voucher ID field|host specimen voucher ID slot

label: alternative sample ID field
definition: A data field which describes an alternative sample identifier assigned to the sample by another organization.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide any alternative identifiers for the sample here, separated by commas. Alternative identifiers assigned to the sample should be tracked along with original IDs to establish chain of custody. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.
english exact synonym: alternative sample ID slot|alternative sample identifier field|alternative sample identifier slot

label: sample collected by field
definition: A data field which describes the name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated.
comment: Example Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.

label: sample collected by laboratory name field
definition: A data field which describes the specific laboratory affiliation of the sample collector.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that collected the sample (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.
english exact synonym: sample collected by laboratory name slot

label: sample collection project name field
definition: A data field which describes the project/initiative/program for which the sample was collected.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the project and/or the project ID here. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

label: sample plan name field
definition: A data field which describes the name of the study design for a surveillance project.
example of usage: National Microbiological Baseline Study in Broiler Chicken
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the sample plan used for sample collection. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

label: sample plan ID field
definition: A data field which describes the identifier of the study design for a surveillance project.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the identifier of the sample plan used for sample collection. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.
english exact synonym: sample plan ID slot|sample plan identifier field|sample plan identifier slot

label: sample collector contact name field
definition: A data field which describes the name or job title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more preferable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

label: sample collector contact email field
definition: A data field which describes the email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
comment: Example Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

label: sample collector contact address field
definition: A data field which describes the mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
example of usage: 655 Lab St, Vancouver, British Columbia, V5N 2A2, Canada
comment: Example Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, State/Province/Region, Country, Postal Code/Zip Code

editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequence_submitted_by' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001159.
comment: Example Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions. If submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the .National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)..

label: sequenced by contact name field
definition: A data field which describes the name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequence submitted by contact name' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100474
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

label: sequenced by contact email field

editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequence submitter contact email' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001165

label: sequenced by contact address field
definition: A data field which describes the mailing address of the agency submitting the sequence.
example of usage: 123 Sunnybrooke St, Toronto, Ontario, M4P 1L6, Canada
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequence submitter contact address' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001167

label: sequenced by laboratory name field
definition: A data field which describes the specific laboratory affiliation of those responsible for sequencing the isolate's genome.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that that performed the sequencing in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

label: sequence submitted by field
definition: A data field which describes the name of the agency that submitted the sequence to a database.
example of usage: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequenced by' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100416
comment: Example Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.

label: sequence submitted by contact name field
definition: A data field which describes the name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the submission of the sequence to a repository or database.
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequenced by contact name' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100471
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.
english exact synonym: sequence submitted by contact name slot

label: sequence submitter contact email field
definition: A data field which describes the email address of the agency responsible for submission of the sequence.
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequenced by contact email' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100422
comment: Example Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

example of usage: 123 Sunnybrooke St, Toronto, Ontario, M4P 1L6, Canada
editor note: Not to be confused with 'sequenced by contact address' http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100423
comment: Example Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, State/Province/Region, Country, Postal Code/Zip Code

comment: Example UI Definition: The user-defined identifier assigned to a genome reconstructed from metagenomic data. | Example Guidance: Store the MAG ID.

editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The unique identifier assigned to an assembly or consensus sequence in GenBank archives. | Example Guidance: Store the versioned GenBank accession assigned to the submitted sequence.

editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in ENA (European Nucleotide Archive) archives. | Example Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. ENA accessions start with SAMEA.
english broad synonym: ENA accession slot | European Nucleotide Archive accession field | European Nucleotide Archive accession slot

label: DRA accession field
definition: An identifier field which describes the alphanumeric accession assigned to a sequence in the DNA Data Bank of Japan (DDBJ) sequence read archive (DRA).
editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in DRA (DDBJ Sequence Read Archive) archives. | Example Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. DRA accessions start with DRA.
english broad synonym: DRA accession slot | DDBJ Sequence Read Archive accession field | DDBJ Sequence Read Archive accession slot

label: GSA accession field
definition: An identifier field which describes the alphanumeric accession assigned to a sequence in the Genome Sequence Archive (GSA).
editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in GSA (Genome Sequence Archive) archives. | Example Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. GSA accessions start with CRA.
english broad synonym: GSA accession slot | Genome Sequence Archive accession field | Genome Sequence Archive accession slot

label: Enterobase accession field
definition: An identifier field which describes the alphanumeric string to a sequence in Enterobase archives.
editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The identifier assigned to a sequence in Enterobase archives. | Example Guidance: Store the barcode assigned to the submitted sequence. Enterobase barcodes start with different 3 letter codes depending on the organism.

label: sampling site ID field
definition: An identifier field which describes the user-defined identifier assigned to a specific location from which samples are taken.
editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific location from which samples are taken. | Example Guidance: Store the ID for the site from which a sample was taken. The "site" is user defined (e.g. it may be a building and its environs, a specific entity within an environment). Please use the same site ID for all samples from a given site, regardless of when these samples were taken. Any important changes in site location, should be represented with a new site ID.

label: sampling event ID field
definition: An identifier field which describes the user-defined identifier assigned to a specific event during which one or more samples are taken, from one or more sites.
editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific event during which one or more samples are taken, from one or more sites. | Example Guidance: Store the ID for the event during which a sample or samples were taken. For example, an event could be one person taking samples from multiple sites, or multiple people taking samples from one site.

label: specimen collector project ID field
definition: A data field which describes the user-defined project name assigned to a sequencing project.
editor note: Drafted 2023-11-03
comment: Example Guidance: If the sample was collected or analyzed under the umbrella of a specific project, include the name of that project here. | Example UI Definition: The user-defined project name assigned to a sequencing project.

label: DNA fragment length field

editor note: Drafted 2023-07-27
comment: Example UI Definition: The length of the DNA fragment generated by mechanical shearing or enzymatic digestion for the purposes of library preparation. | Example Guidance: Provide the fragment length in base pairs (do not include the units).

label: genomic target enrichment method field

editor note: Drafted 2023-12-02
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the enrichment method | Example UI Definition: The molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.

example of usage: enrichment was done using Twist's respiratory virus research panel https://www.twistbioscience.com/products/ngs/fixed-panels/respiratory-virus-research-panel
editor note: Drafted 2023-12-02
comment: Example Guidance: Provide details that are applicable to the method you used. | Example UI Definition: Details that provide additional context to the molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.

label: sequencing assay type field

example of usage: whole genome sequencing assay, 16S ribosomal gene sequencing assay
editor note: Drafted 2023-12-20
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the DNA or RNA sequencing technology used in your study. If unsure refer to the protocol documentation, or provide a null value. | Example UI Definition: The overarching sequencing methodology that was used to determine the sequence of a biomaterial.

label: date field
definition: A data field which describes the particular day, month and/or year an event has happened or will happen.

label: sample collection date field
definition: A data field which describes the date on which the sample was collected.
comment: Example Guidance: Record the collection date accurately in the template. Required granularity includes year, month and day. Before sharing this data, ensure this date is not considered identifiable information. If this date is considered identifiable, it is acceptable to add .jitter. to the collection date by adding or subtracting calendar days. Do not change the collection date in your original records. Alternatively, ”received date” may be used as a substitute in the data you share. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 standard format .YYYY-MM-DD..

label: sample collection date precision field
definition: A data field which describes the precision to which the "sample collection date" was provided.
comment: Used to further describe the .sample collection date field. [GENEPIO:0001174].  Example Guidance: Provide the precision of granularity to the .day., .month., or .year. for the date provided in the .sample collection date. field. The .sample collection date. will be truncated to the precision specified upon export; .day. for .YYYY-MM-DD., .month. for .YYYY-MM., or .year. for .YYYY..

label: sample received date field
definition: A data field which describes the date on which the sample was received.
comment: Example Guidance: The date the sample was received by a lab that was not the point of collection. ISO 8601 standard .YYYY-MM-DD..

label: original sample description field
definition: A data field which describes the original sample description provided by the sample collector.
comment: Example Guidance: Provide the sample description provided by the original sample collector. The original description is useful as it may provide further details, or can be used to clarify higher level classifications.

label: geographical location field

definition: A data field which describes the longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.

english exact synonym: geo_loc longitude slot|geographical location longitude field|geographical location longitude slot
